授業方法: Online classes will be organized during COVID-19 crisis. Lecture and seminar discussions

第1回: 4/14 Introduction and overview of the class, objectives, expectations by students
Assignment Students search for a communication strategy for corona virus outbreak to present at the class on 21 April (one minute presentation)
第2回:
4/21 Communication theory
Communication channels and tools
Assessment of communication needs
Students will search for a UN agency’s corona virus communication strategy and analyse its communication needs and the reasons for selected channels and tools (One-page report)
第3回:
4/28 Development of communication strategies:
Using tool kits
Examples from field offices and RC office

Assignment: Taking a UN agency’s country office communication strategy, students prepare 3 slides-3 min presentation Assignment: Taking a UN agency’s organizational communication strategy, students analyse key elements
第5回: 5/19 Purpose and principles of UN's global communication: (Guest) UN Department of Global Communications. UN’s overall communication is coordinated based on well-defined communication strategy.
Assignment: Students select specific communication activity of UNHQ and relate it with the global communication strategy
第6回:
5/26 UN Information Centers:
Role of UNIC in each country
Aligning with global communication strategy
Assignment: Students identify challenges in implementing the UN’s global communication strategy in one selected country
第7回:
6/2 Communication opportunities:
Presentation and public speaking, Advocacy and persuasive communication processes
Assignment: Develop a communication strategy for promoting human rights in a specific country and prepare a 3-slide presentation
第8回:
6/9 Programme communication: (guest)
Immunization and other health issues
Ebola outbreak and risk communication
第9回: 6/16 UN English writing standards and house style:
Assignment: Students review their past assignments based on the UN house style and submit revised assignment reports
第10回:
6/23 Branding and marketing principles:
UNICEF’s branding strategy
Using marketing strategies
Social marketing
Assignment: Students Search for a UN agency branding strategy and compare it with UNICEF’s. Prepare 3 slides presentation_
第11回:
6/30 Use of latest technologies and social media
Social media guidelines
Impact assessment and risks
Assignment: Students analyse their own SNS use and develop a communication strategy for their personal branding. 2-slides presentation
第12回:
7/7 Handling media interviews and other public relations opportunities:
Talking to the media, TV and radio
Hard talk
Ambush interview
Assignment: Listen to BBC’s hard talk with ex-UNSG Kofi Anan, and identify which part was the most difficult question and assess how Kofi Anan managed.
第13回:
7/14 Communication for social change
Advocacy and policy advice
Social innovation process
Changing for sustainable impact
Assignment: Students prepare communication strategies on specific issues of their choice
第14回:
7/21 Students' presentation on communication strategy on specific issues
Evaluation of presentation and class evaluation
